subject: Climate & Environment
title: Greenland's Melting Ice Sheet
description: A short lesson to help you apply Greenland's Melting Ice Sheet.

hook.text: Greenland loses about 270 billion tons of ice each year. The rate is accelerating.

buildup.text: Meltwater pools on the surface, darkening the ice and absorbing more sunlight.

discovery.text: Some of that water drills through the ice sheet, lubricating its base and speeding glacier flow.

twist.text: Greenland alone holds enough ice to raise global sea levels by 7.4 meters if fully melted.

climax.text: Even partial melting would redraw every coastline on Earth over the coming centuries.

punchline.text: Greenland is melting from above, below, and within. All at once.

quiz.question: How much could sea levels rise if Greenland's ice sheet fully melted?
